page.title: 02National Guides Week
page.content: The 3rd Banbury Guides who meet at St. Pauls Hall in Prescott Avenue, Banbury took part in the National Guide week which was to celebrate 75 years of Guiding. To start the week they spent Sunday 23rd June at Oxford City Football Stadium. All the Guide Companies from Oxfordshire attended. The day started with a parade of the company flags and a short service. It was followed by activities such as tent pitching, gadget making, chair racing, and dancing etc. On the Monday Mrs. Pleydell-Bouverie, the County Commissioner visited Buckingham Palace to collect a light from the "Flame of Friendship" lit by Princess Margaret. She brought the Flame back to Oxford and the Ranger Guides then carried it to Banbury on a canal narrow-boat.
